issue.title: Objects of target "oqs" referenced but is not an OBJECT library.
issue.body:
liboqs build failed on ``Objects of target "oqs" referenced but is not an OBJECT library.`` I am using the Dockerfile of Python Buster

I am trying to install all the debs through https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/blob/main/scripts/fullbuild.sh

It seems that Python Buster using older CMake https://discourse.cmake.org/t/objects-of-target-x-referenced-but-is-not-an-object-library/3857

Is there a way to fix this issue?

My Dockerfile 

```Dockerfile
FROM python:3.8.12-buster

RUN apt-get update && apt-get -y install --no-install-recommends \
    docker.io astyle cmake gcc ninja-build libssl-dev python3-pytest \
    python3-pytest-xdist unzip xsltproc doxygen graphviz python3-yaml valgrind
```

```sh
#0 69.30 cloning liboqs main...
#0 69.30 Cloning into 'liboqs'...
#0 70.51 -- The C compiler identification is GNU 8.3.0
#0 70.53 -- The ASM compiler identification is GNU
#0 70.53 -- Found assembler: /usr/bin/cc
#0 70.53 -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc
#0 70.63 -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc -- works
#0 70.64 -- Detecting C compiler ABI info
#0 70.75 -- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
#0 70.75 -- Detecting C compile features
#0 71.09 -- Detecting C compile features - done
#0 71.10 -- Performing Test CC_SUPPORTS_WA_NOEXECSTACK
#0 71.21 -- Performing Test CC_SUPPORTS_WA_NOEXECSTACK - Success
#0 71.21 CMake Warning at .CMake/compiler_opts.cmake:35 (message):
#0 71.21   Unable to check if '-Wl,-z,noexecstack' is supported.
#0 71.21 Call Stack (most recent call first):
#0 71.21   CMakeLists.txt:119 (include)
#0 71.21
#0 71.21
#0 71.21 -- Looking for pthread.h
#0 71.31 -- Looking for pthread.h - found
#0 71.31 -- Looking for pthread_create
#0 71.42 -- Looking for pthread_create - not found
#0 71.43 -- Check if compiler accepts -pthread
#0 71.54 -- Check if compiler accepts -pthread - yes
#0 71.55 -- Found Threads: TRUE
#0 71.57 -- Algorithms filtered for KEM_kyber_768
#0 71.73 -- Found OpenSSL: /optbuild/oqs-provider/.local/lib/libcrypto.a (Required is at least version "1.1.1")
#0 71.79 -- Looking for aligned_alloc
#0 71.90 -- Looking for aligned_alloc - found
#0 71.90 -- Looking for posix_memalign
#0 72.02 -- Looking for posix_memalign - found
#0 72.03 -- Looking for memalign
#0 72.14 -- Looking for memalign - found
#0 72.14 -- Looking for explicit_bzero
#0 72.25 -- Looking for explicit_bzero - found
#0 72.25 -- Looking for memset_s
#0 72.30 -- Looking for memset_s - not found
#0 72.66 -- Found Doxygen: /usr/bin/doxygen (found version "1.8.13") found components:  doxygen dot
#0 72.74 -- Configuring done
#0 72.74 CMake Error at tests/CMakeLists.txt:74 (add_executable):
#0 72.74   Error evaluating generator expression:
#0 72.74
#0 72.74     $<TARGET_OBJECTS:oqs>
#0 72.74
#0 72.74   Objects of target "oqs" referenced but is not an OBJECT library.
#0 72.74
#0 72.74
#0 72.75 -- Build files have been written to: /optbuild/oqs-provider/liboqs/build
#0 72.75 CMake Error at tests/CMakeLists.txt:74 (add_executable):
#0 72.75   No SOURCES given to target: kat_kem
#0 72.75
#0 72.75
#0 72.75 liboqs build failed. Exiting.
```

comment.body:
> > It seems that Python Buster using older CMake https://discourse.cmake.org/t/objects-of-target-x-referenced-but-is-not-an-object-library/3857
> 
> > Is there a way to fix this issue?
> 
> You're welcome to provide a PR to `liboqs` that would permit using an older `cmake` version, but the core OQS team doesn't have the bandwidth to support all possible platform combinations. You do [touch on a code line in liboqs though](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/4906c3fc880328453a9efccde860e11adc5fea29/CMakeLists.txt#L3) that I think warrants updating. This also already led to excess/unwarranted work in the `liboqs` [CI environment](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/pull/68): That PR may be instructive as to how to solve/work around this issue @vkosuri : Just upgrade `cmake`.

Thanks for the workaround, The cmake Docker build process very slow almost 10M, I found through search another workaround using ``pip`` which very quicker.

Can I make PR here https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/tree/main?

```Dockerfile
RUN pip install --upgarde cmake==3.22.1
```

comment.body:
> another workaround using pip which very quicker

Thank you very much for teaching an old dog a new trick, @vkosuri ! I'd never have thought to use `python` to install `cmake`... Yes, PR's to improve our project(s) are always welcome.
